SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 22 (Xinhua) -- Amazon Web Services (AWS) announced on Monday that adidas AG, one of the major sports brands in the world, has selected AWS as its preferred cloud provider for SAP workloads.

Adidas will migrate its SAP environment to AWS. The migration will enable adidas to digitize core business processes across its value chain to provide better consumer experiences, become a more data-driven business, and support new business models such as direct-to-consumer, the announcement said.

This new cloud-based system will support the company's physical sales channel to be integrated with AWS capabilities, such as machine learning and analytics, to streamline the supply chain, inventory, and merchandising operations for retail stores around the world, according to the announcement.

By creating a cloud-based consumer experience, adidas can offer personalized discounts, early access to new releases and collaborations, priority consumer service, and the ability to personalize experiences and offers, it added.

"By committing to cloud infrastructure, we have the scalability and elasticity we need to handle the seasonality of our business during peak demand, and support the projected growth in our e-commerce business in the years to come," said Markus Rautert, senior vice president of technology enablement at adidas AG.
